headline: Mrs. Payson's SPAM® and Grits Brunch Casserole
description: Grits, cheese, and luncheon meat combine into a breakfast casserole that can be put together the night before.
name: Mrs. Payson's SPAM® and Grits Brunch Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (12 ounce) can fully cooked luncheon meat (such as SPAM®), grated

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

Bring the water to a boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Slowly pour the grits into the water while stirring constantly. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the grits are tender and thick, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir the grits constantly as they cook. Set aside.

Heat a skillet over medium-high heat, and sprinkle in the grated luncheon meat. Cook, turning occasionally, until the luncheon meat has browned. Pour off any excess grease, and stir half of the luncheon meat into the grits along with the tomatoes, sour cream, and half of the Cheddar cheese. Pour the grits into the prepared baking dish, and sprinkle with the remaining luncheon meat and Cheddar cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until the casserole is hot and the cheese has melted and is bubbly, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I used bacon flavored Spam and it came out great! I used more cheese than the recipe called for, next time I won't put so much on top. It was a bit too much. Also it would be really good with flavored diced tomatoes (maybe with green chile or jalapeno) and some jack cheese instead or in addition too. Overall, will definitely make again.

My daughters and I both give this 5 stars. We have a mother/daughters dinner every week and sometimes I fix breakfast for dinner. I love to try new recipes, and they loved this one. They requested this a lot more even if it is not a 'breakfast' dinner. Thanks for sharing.
I loved it! I used Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. I also just mixed everything together instead of layering it. This will be our new way to eat grits.

I made it. I didn't have quite enough cheddar cheese so I used American in the casserole and sprinkled about 3/4 cup of shredded cheddar on top. I wasn't crazy about the spam, next time I'll use cubed cooked ham instead. Oh yeah, I added butter and a little sprinkle of garlic powder and paprika because that's how I make my grits.
This is a great new casserole that I have added to my recipe box. It's always good to have another good recipe.

I had not bought a can of spam in 20+ years, but I had some grits I needed to use and and wanted to try something new, and this popped up. Gotta say - I was pleasantly surprised. Who woulda thunk to grate spam? It was very good, and the recipe is easy to tweak to your personal tastes or other ingredients you want to use up. Go for it!
My family enjoyed this. I made it exactly as the recipe was written. I think next time I will use a little less cheese and a little more spam. Or perhaps just add a little bacon.

I used a 10 oz. can of diced tomatoes with green chilies and 8 oz of regular greek yogurt. I like the idea of this casserole, but the flavor was not to my liking. I guess I'm just not a big Spam fan. Next time I will try it with bacon instead and regular diced tomatoes.

This shocked me! It was really quite tasty. I was originally put off by the SPAM idea, but was able to "lighten" this up a bit, to about 220 calories for a decently sized portion. I used 2% milk cheddar cheese, fat free plain yogurt, and turkey SPAM instead of regular SPAM. Also, I had fresh tomatoes on hand so I diced those up instead of using canned, and just microwaved my grits because I had a few packets in the pantry. I would make this again but my husband wasn't even interested in trying it. He said he was put off by the look of it.

I used bacon flavored Spam and it came out great! I used more cheese than the recipe called for, next time I won't put so much on top. It was a bit too much. Also it would be really good with flavored diced tomatoes (maybe with green chile or jalapeno) and some jack cheese instead or in addition too. Overall, will definitely make again.

item.name: Mrs. Payson's SPAM® and Grits Brunch Casserole
